questions: What is the main purpose of documentation in IT?
answers: To record problems, fixes, and system details so future work is faster and consistent.

questions: Why do organizations use ticketing systems?
answers: To track issues, prioritize work, and keep a history of support requests.

questions: What is an SLA (service level agreement) used for?
answers: To define expected response/resolution times and service expectations.

questions: Why is change management important?
answers: It prevents unexpected downtime by planning, approving, and tracking system changes.

questions: What is the purpose of a backup schedule?
answers: To ensure data is saved regularly so it can be restored after loss or failure.

questions: What is the main goal of disaster recovery planning?
answers: To restore services and data quickly after major failures or disasters.

questions: Why is ESD protection used when working with components?
answers: To prevent static electricity from damaging sensitive electronics.

questions: What is the purpose of using a wrist strap when building PCs?
answers: To safely discharge static electricity and protect components.

questions: Why should you verify a user’s identity before resetting passwords?
answers: To prevent unauthorized access and account takeovers.

questions: What is the purpose of acceptable use policies?
answers: To explain what users can and cannot do with company devices and networks.

questions: Why is asset tagging important?
answers: It helps track and manage devices for inventory, repairs, and ownership.

questions: What is the purpose of a standard operating procedure (SOP)?
answers: To ensure tasks are done the same safe and correct way every time.

questions: Why should you keep work areas clean and organized during repairs?
answers: To prevent lost screws/parts, reduce mistakes, and improve safety.

questions: What is the purpose of labeling cables?
answers: To make troubleshooting and future changes faster and less confusing.

questions: Why should you follow the principle of least privilege in operations?
answers: To reduce risk by limiting what accounts can change or access.

questions: What is the function of a chain of custody for devices?
answers: To track who handled equipment, especially when sensitive data is involved.

questions: Why is it important to communicate clearly with a user during support?
answers: It sets expectations, reduces frustration, and helps gather accurate info.

questions: What is the purpose of a maintenance window?
answers: A planned time to do updates/repairs when it will impact users the least.

questions: Why should you test a fix before closing a ticket?
answers: To confirm the problem is solved and the system works normally.

questions: What is “professional conduct” in IT support?
answers: Being respectful, protecting privacy, and following policies while helping users.
